H0.text: who became a leader of the indian national congress. Jawaharlal Nehru

H1.text: who became a leader of the indian national congress. Subhas Chandra Bose

H2.text: who became a leader of the indian national congress. Lala Lajpat Rai

H3.text: who became a leader of the indian national congress. Mahatma Gandhi

A4.text: The party's first prime minister, Jawaharlal Nehru, led the Congress to support socialist policies by creating the Planning Commission, introducing Five-Year Plans, implementing a mixed economy, and establishing a secular state.

A5.text: With the help of the moderate group led by Gokhale, in 1924 Gandhi became president of Congress.

A6.text: In February 1938, Nehru did not stand for re-election as president, and was succeeded by Subash Chandra Bose.
